Body: Possible Duplicate:  How can I free up more space on my Android (2.2 Froyo) phone?  I have been trying to understand how to solve my phone's problem by reading threads/questions dealing with this problem. However, I cannot interpret the techno-babble. Apparently, I need to 'root' my phone, but I also saw it wasn't for the 'faint-hearted,' of which I am one.Could someone please direct me to a guide that can explain this process in the easiest terms? Where do I start, how do I proceed, what programs/operating systems do I need, etc. I don't even know what questions to ask at this point. All I know is that my phone has progressively run out of space, despite my deleting everything I can. It's now running very sluggishly and reboots on its own, and I have to take the battery out often to reset it, etc.I just don't have the know-how or time to sift through all the threads/websites discussing this. Can someone please help?Thanks so much!
Title: HTC Desire - ran out of storage - can't interpret solutions offered - need help!

history.Text: I have been trying to understand how to solve my phone's problem by reading threads/questions dealing with this problem.  My problem is that I cannot interpret the techno-babble.  Apparently, I need to 'root' my phone.  but I also saw it wasn't for the 'faint-hearted', which I am.  Could someone please direct me to a guide that can explain this process in the easiest terms?  Where do I start, how do I proceed, what programs/operating system to do need, etc.  I don't even know what questions to ask at this point.  All I know is that my phone has progressively run out of space, despite my deleting everything I can.  And now it's even running very sluggishly, re-boots on it's own, I have to take the battery out often to reset it, etc.  And I just don't have the know-how or time to sift through all the threads/website discussing this. Can someone please help??Thanks so much!!!
